class_notes:
Final Assessment: Scheduled In-Class Exam
Students may take ADR and Negotiations.  This section DOES NOT meet the Experiential Credit requirement.
This course is eligible to be counted towards the requirements for the J.D. concentration in Civil Litigation and Dispute Resolution.
course_description: This lecture course will focus on arbitration law and process, focusing on the law governing arbitration in the United States. In particular, it will focus on the Federal Arbitration Act, and the resulting State Laws and cases decided according to it.
sections: Class Nbr: 2829, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10:15-11:45a, Instructor: M. Broyde, Status: Open
